alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Bennington and northwestern Windham Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dorset, or 8 miles northwest of Manchester, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Londonderry, Manchester, Stratton, Dorset, Manchester Center, West Wardsboro, Jamaica, Rupert, Peru, Stratton Valley, Beartown, Bondville, Peru Town Center, Stratton Acres, Rawsonville, Intervale, Barnumville, Freedleyville, Thompsonburg and West Rupert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
